questions.question: What problem does Osmosis solve?

answer.summary: Allocator decisions are spoken in meetings before they appear in databases. Osmosis listens to those public conversations in real-time and turns them into predictive alerts—so you're first in the room with the right angle.
details: **The math:** One $100M mandate at ~1% fees = ~$5M over five years. That's 1,000× our annual cost. Our users regularly source $100M+ opportunities and see ~20% presentation hit rates (vs. ~5% industry norm).
**The difference:** While your competitors are reading last month's minutes, you're referencing yesterday's IC discussion.

questions.question: "Day in the Life" — From alert to mandate

answer.summary: Here's how Osmosis transforms your fundraising from reactive to predictive:
details: **8:30 AM** — Email alert: "Texas Teachers IC discussing increased private credit pacing from 5% to 8%. CIO wants options by next meeting."
• Shows who said it (CIO vs consultant vs staff)
• IC chair: Former Goldman, knows your senior partner
• Consultant: Aksia, recently recommended similar strategy
• Staff PM: Published paper on credit diversification
**9:00 AM** — Execute with our talk track:
• Loop in partner who knows IC chair
**Week 2** — Meeting booked (they're impressed you knew their timeline)
**Month 3** — RFP issued; you're already in dialogue

questions.question: Who is Osmosis for?

answer.summary: Heads of IR/Distribution at asset managers ($100M+ AUM) who are tired of learning about mandates from consultant memos.
details: • Relationship managers hunting for warm leads
• PMs who want to know who's actually deploying capital
• RevOps teams who operationalize signals into pipeline
• ✓ You find out about mandates after competitors have pitched
• ✓ Your team works from static databases, not live signals
• ✓ Your presentation hit rate is stuck at 5-10%
• ✓ You're losing to firms that "somehow knew" about opportunities first

questions.question: What is Osmosis in one sentence?

answer.summary: Osmosis monitors public allocator meetings in real-time, using AI to extract who's allocating, what they said, and who influences decisions—then delivers personalized alerts with exact quotes and relationship maps to your team within hours, not months.

questions.question: What strategies and asset classes do you cover?

answer.summary: Full coverage: Private Equity, Venture Capital, Private Credit, Real Estate, Infrastructure, Natural Resources, Hedge Funds (all strategies)
details: • Manager graduations and emerging manager programs
answer.proof: Contact us to learn more about our coverage for your specific strategy.

questions.question: Why is "real-time" better than comprehensive databases?

answer.summary: Library vs. Radar comparison:
details: • **Databases (Library):** Great for looking up last year's commitments
• **Osmosis (Radar):** Great for knowing who's committing next quarter
• **Monday:** Oregon IC discusses increasing PE allocation
• **Monday afternoon:** Osmosis alert to relevant managers
• **6 weeks later:** Database updates show "considering PE increase"
• **Before:** Read about mandates → Chase RFPs → 5% hit rate
• **Now:** Hear signals → Call first → 20% hit rate

questions.question: We already have Preqin/PitchBook/eVestment—why add Osmosis?

answer.summary: Keep them for what they're great at, add Osmosis for what they can't do.
details: **Keep them for what they're great at:**
**Add Osmosis for what they can't do:**
• **Preqin** tells you who manages $10B → **Osmosis** tells you who's deploying $500M next quarter
• **PitchBook** shows you contact info → **Osmosis** shows you what that contact said yesterday
• **Dakota** lists consultant relationships → **Osmosis** alerts when consultants recommend your strategy
answer.proof: Databases ≠ signals. Use both. Osmosis makes your databases more valuable by telling you who to look up and when to call.

questions.question: What if my competitors are already using Osmosis?

answer.summary: Speed matters, but execution matters more. Osmosis tells everyone the same facts—your differentiation is what you do with them.
details: Plus, we see teams using Osmosis consistently outperform those who don't, even when both have access. Why? Because most firms still take weeks to act on intelligence. If you can move in days, you win.

questions.question: Where do signals come from?

answer.summary: We capture public allocator conversations in real-time from verified sources.
details: • Public pension board and investment committee meetings (live + same-day video)
• CIO and staff interviews in public forums
• Public filings and documents tied to allocation decisions
• 360+ US public plans monitored continuously and increasing on a weekly basis
• Any allocator speaking publicly worldwide (including endowments, foundations, SWFs when they publish)
answer.proof: Every insight links to its public source for verification.

questions.question: What about international, endowments, foundations, and family offices?

answer.summary: Coming soon: Comprehensive US public plan coverage + any allocator speaking publicly worldwide.
details: • **Endowments/Foundations:** Captured when they publish meetings or speak at conferences
• **Sovereign Wealth:** Covered when they release reports or officials speak publicly
• **Family Offices:** Limited to public statements (rare but included when available)

questions.question: How do you ensure accuracy and prevent AI hallucinations?

answer.summary: Every alert includes references to the exact source. You can verify everything before reaching out. No hallucinations, just facts with receipts.
details: • **Speaker attribution:** We know who said it (CIO vs consultant vs trustee)
• **Source links:** Click through to exact timestamp or document page
• **Confidence scoring:** We flag when we're uncertain
• **User verification:** "Report Issue" button with rapid review
answer.proof: Every alert includes references to the exact source for verification.

questions.question: Do you handle MNPI? How is customer data treated?

answer.summary: No MNPI—ever. We only process publicly available information.
details: • Customer watchlists and notes are ring-fenced
• Not used to train models (unless you explicitly opt in)
• Full audit trail of who sees what
answer.proof: For more details, read our [Terms of Use](https://osmosis.fm/terms).

questions.question: How fast is onboarding?

answer.summary: Under 2 minutes. Accept invite → AI builds your watchlist → alerts start flowing.
details: • Day 1: Team trained on signal interpretation
• Week 1: First meeting booked from signal
answer.proof: No engineering required. No IT tickets. No data migration. Just results.

questions.question: What integrations do you support?

answer.summary: Instant deployment with CRM integration coming soon.
details: • Web app with search and filters
• **Salesforce/HubSpot:** Push signals as custom objects, auto-create tasks, track as "Allocator-Sourced"
• **Other CRMs:** Weekly CSV export or webhook to middleware
• Signal type (pacing change, new search, consultant rec)

questions.question: How do you justify the cost?

answer.summary: The math is simple: Value of one mandate: ~$5M over 5 years. ROI: 100× on one win, 1,000× if you win 10.
details: • "Paid for itself in the first month"
• "Should be 10× the price based on value"
answer.proof: Scaled by team size, not AUM. Everyone from emerging managers to $100B platforms can access the same intelligence.

questions.question: What's your maturity model? How do I know if we'll succeed?

answer.summary: Quick self-assessment to see where you stand:
details: • □ Learn about mandates from RFPs or news
answer.proof: If you're Level 1 or 2, Osmosis can 3× your speed to market.

questions.question: Can I see what my competitors are doing?

answer.summary: Yes, when they present in public. You'll see:
details: • Who else presented at recent board meetings
• When competitors get mentioned in meetings
**What you won't see:** Private interactions, closed-door discussions, or anything that wasn't said publicly
answer.proof: You'll know the competitive landscape before the RFP drops, not after.

questions.question: What proof can you share?

answer.summary: Activity metrics:
answer.proof: "I've sourced two $100M+ opportunities from Osmosis in the past month." — Aaron, Relationship Manager, $30B Hedge Fund

answer.summary: Three options:

2. **Free coverage check** — See exactly what we track for your focus areas
answer.proof: We're confident in our ROI math. If you can't see the value in 15 minutes, we'll tell you ourselves.
